thread.title: Cubs-Mets: NLCS predictions

author: chicagotribune.com
title: Cubs-Mets: NLCS predictions
text:
Mark Gonzales: Jon Lester and Jake Arrieta will be available to make two starts apiece if needed, and manager Joe Maddon will figure out a creative way to get through Games 3 and 4. Cubs in six games.
David Haugh: This isn't revenge for 1969. This isn't anything other than a young team peaking at the right time, rested starting pitchers and a manager whose charisma and intelligence make the Cubs better than the Mets â€” and just maybe everyone. Cubs in six games.
Colleen Kane: This is a better Mets team than the one the Cubs took all seven games from in the regular season, but the Cubs' young hitters will continue on their roll, even against the Mets' formidable young pitchers. Cubs in six games.
Fred Mitchell: The Cubs had the Mets' number during the regular season, but this is a retooled Mets team that will provide stiffer postseason opposition. The young Cubs are a fastball-hitting juggernaut who appear destined for the World Series. Cubs in six games.
Paul Sullivan: True, the Cubs have no dominant starters after Jon Lester and Jake Arrieta, but it hasn't mattered. Despite all the strikeouts, the young Cubs hitters have found a way to win, and there's no reason this series should be any different. Cubs in five games.
